In a message dated 9/3/2003 4:39:39 PM Central Daylight Time, 
swords@... writes:
Looked at a sword for a friend last evening which had something I've never 
seen before. The fuchi--all that remained of the tsuka fittings--was of plain 
shakudo with the motif of (I'm guessing) a "Noh character" and a "closed fan in 
a holder." Oddly, this decoration was "pinned" to the fuchi rather than 
soldered on. Never saw that before! Actually, it was a bit loose and seemed like a 
careless way of attaching this to the base metal, but it was quite old and done 
originally and not post-war by some GI. Anyone else ever seen this method 
used?

Ron
STL
Ron,
I have a nanako ground fucchi with a tiny square hole...I assumed some " 
decoration "  ( a mon ? )had fallen out.

Milt
